name: Prostatic Calculi with Chronic Prostatitis
chief_complaint: I have persistent pain in my lower pelvis and trouble urinating.
physical_findings: tender prostate on digital rectal exam
prognosis: Good with treatment, but may recur; chronic cases may require long-term management.
description: Prostatic calculi are small stones that form in the prostate gland, often associated with chronic inflammation or infection (chronic prostatitis). They can cause obstruction and persistent symptoms similar to benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) or chronic pelvic pain syndrome.
